alert.note: Alert for Dickey; La Moure; Stutsman (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 05 at 2:16AM CST until January 06 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations up to half an inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Dickey, La Moure and Stutsman Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 9 AM this morning to Noon CST Thursday. For the Blizzard Warning, until 9 AM CST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure to wear appropriate winter clothing and cover all exposed skin. Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. Notify a friend or family member of your travel plans. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
